case_title: Hidayatullah and 21 Others vs Noor Muhammad and 49 Others
complaint_summary: The respondents filed a suit seeking declaration and partition of joint property measuring 4,002 acres, 2 rods, and 36 poles as per revenue records.
investigation_summary: The Assistant Commissioner rejected a power-of-attorney and joint written statement filed by the defendants, ordered substituted service, and declared the defendants ex parte. Subsequent appeals and revisions were dismissed.
judgment_summary: The court declared the ex parte order dated 16th June 1982 and subsequent orders as illegal and remanded the case to the Assistant Commissioner for further proceedings. The court instructed the parties to appear without further notice, and co-sharers were to be issued notices.
Decision_or_verdict: Case remanded to the Assistant Commissioner.
legal_arguments: Suit for declaration under Section 42 of the Specific Relief Act was not competent under the Ordinance.
Suit was barred by Section 172 of the West Pakistan Land Revenue Act.
Assistant Commissioner improperly rejected the power-of-attorney.
Appeal dismissal due to limitation was unjustified.
assets: Land measuring 4,002 acres, 2 rods, and 36 poles.
statutes: West Pakistan Land Revenue Act, Section 172
key_issues: Competency of suit under Ordinance I of 1968.

maxims.Legal Principle: Orders based on void actions are themselves void.

legal_terms.Ex Parte: Legal proceedings conducted without the presence of one party.
legal_terms.Substituted Service: Service of legal notice through alternative methods like publication.

words_and_phrases.Power-of-Attorney: Legal authorization to act on behalf of another.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a dispute over land partition and procedural irregularities in service and representation. The court remanded the case due to illegal ex parte orders and procedural errors.

key_issues_details.ex_parte_order: Declared illegal and subsequent orders nullified.

legal_provisions_details.specific_relief_act_section_42: Suit for declaration deemed not competent under Ordinance.
legal_provisions_details.evidence_act_section_85: Presumption of execution and authentication of power-of-attorney.

petitioners_arguments: Suit for declaration not competent under Ordinance.
Partition suit barred under West Pakistan Land Revenue Act.
Ex parte order illegal and appeal wrongly dismissed.
respondents_arguments: Suit for declaration competent under Ordinance.
Partition suit not barred under West Pakistan Land Revenue Act.
Appeal dismissal due to time-bar proper.

decision_details.instructions: Parties to appear without further notice; co-sharers to be issued notices.
